seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Siloam Springs's June Fourth Friday Is Bike Night
posts.content:
Siloam Springs will celebrate this month's Fourth Friday with the theme Bike Night at Memorial Park on Jun 23 from 4-8p.

  • Party town: Gather with the community for a night of live music, food trucks & vendors, family activities, and fun with other bike enthusiasts.
  • Wheely cool: Decorate your bike and show it off during the bike parade at 6p, then circle back to the Chautauqua Amphitheater for a night of jazz and swing dancing with the NWA Jazz & More Orchestra at 6:30p.

Find out more information HERE.

posts.title: Join Phat Tire For A Group Ride To The Gulley Park Concert Series
posts.content:
Make an entrance at tonight's Gulley Park Concert in a group ride led by Phat Tire Fayetteville. Kids, families, couples, singles ‚Äì everyone is welcome for this no-drop ride.

  • Ride up: Riders can meet at Phat Tire at 6:30p for a leisurely 4-mi ride to Gulley Park, where they can snag free stickers at the City Park Tent and use the complimentary bike valet.
  • Rock on: This week, the Gulley Park Concert Series continues with four-piece bluegrass sensation Arkansauce, the NWA Mini Makers Market, and an array of food trucks.

Join one of the best summer rides with Phat Tire Bike Shop HERE!

posts.title: Celebrate Summer With $40 Tickets To Brothers Osborne At The Momentary
posts.content:
The Momentary is celebrating the start of summer with a flash sale on tickets to see Brothers Osborne perform on Jul 15.

  • Here's the duo: Brothers Osborne is a Grammy Award-winning country-rock duo whose unique sound has earned nine Grammy nominations, numerous CMA and ACM awards, and recognition as one of Nashville's most distinct acts.
  • Here's the deal: No discount code is needed for the sale. Just snag your $40 tickets online before the flash sale ends tomorrow, Jun 23, at 10a.

Don't miss the sale! Buy your tickets HERE.

posts.title: Learn The Basics Of Paddleboarding At Lake Atalanta
posts.content:
Learn how to paddleboard with instructors from Cocoon Yoga Lab during the Paddle & Play session at Lake Atalanta in Rogers this Saturday, Jun 23, from 4-5:30p.

  • SUP 101: The class breaks down the basics of Stand-Up Paddleboarding in a relaxing group setting, including paddle height and hand placement, equipment overview, kneeling and standing on a board, and water safety. Boards, paddles, and life vests are included.
  • Find your flow: Once you master the basics, take your SUP skills to the next level with one of Cocoon Yoga Lab's Float Yoga classes hosted most weekends. This Saturday, Jun 24, enjoy Flow Yoga from 8:30-10a or Yin Yoga from 10:15-11:45a.

Book your spot for Float Yoga HERE.

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Launches Innovative Remuseum Project
posts.content:
Yesterday, Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art announced its launch of Remuseum, a three-year project intended to help U.S. museums become more relevant, sustainable, and in tune with their mission to serve their communities.

  • Innovative approach: Led by Founding Director Stephen Reily, Remuseum will use data to challenge museums to break conventions and create new approaches to relevance, governance, and financial sustainability ‚Äî funding for the project is led by arts patron David Booth and additional support from the Ford Foundation.
  • ‚Äã Visionary vision: Inspired by the unconventional spirit of Crystal Bridges and a commitment to provide radical access to amazing art experiences, Remuseum hopes to amplify that same spirit of innovation in museums nationwide.

Learn more about the Remuseum project HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Ranked Among Top Five US Growth Markets
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas made the top five in the Top 29 Market Report by Synergos Technologies Inc. ‚Äî a study exploring the US markets experiencing the most growth based on Synergos's novel method.

  • Looking back: Northwest Arkansas ranked fifth for the fastest growth rate in the past two years, following Myrtle Beach, SC; Brevard, FL; St. Lucie, FL; and Volusia, FL.
  • Looking forward: Ranking second for projected future growth rate, Northwest Arkansas is expected to reach a population of 736,832 within the next decade.

Read more on Synergos' blog HERE.

posts.title: Creekside Park In Bentonville Now Open
posts.content:
Bentonville celebrated the grand opening of Creekside Park on Saturday, inviting the community to enjoy 35 acres of fun in one of the city's most innovative public parks.

  • First things first: The $7.9m project boasts Northwest Arkansas's first regulation cricket field and Bentonville's first illuminated dog park for nighttime outings with your pup.
  • Connecting the fun: The park includes a destination splash pad, eight lighted pickleball courts, a playground, a picnic pavilion, and a 1.6-mi bike trail that will eventually provide access south to Bentonville Community Center and north to Osage Park, 8th Street Gateway Park, and Coler Mountain Bike Preserve.

Learn more about this exciting new park HERE.

posts.title: Enter A Wine Wonderland At Walton Art Center
posts.content:
Fall down the rabbit hole into a Wine Wonderland during Walton Arts Center's Annual Art of Wine: Uncorked! celebration, featuring hundreds of wines to sample and small bites from local restaurants on Friday, Jul 21, from 8-11p.

  • The Wine Cellar: General admission tickets start at $95. Reserve Room tickets for exclusive access to premium wines are $200. Get early entry at 7:30p for just $25 per person with an Express Pass.
  • All smiles: Proceeds from the delectable evening support the arts education programs of Walton Arts Center, which serve an average of 35,000 school children and teachers annually through arts education and outreach programs.

Reserve your tickets for Uncorked! HERE.

posts.title: Shiloh Museum Seeks Community Input For Use Of Recent Grant
posts.content:
The Shiloh Museum of Ozark History received an $80,000 Community Placemaking Grant from the Project for Public Spaces and is taking public input on how to use the funds.

  • Unique places: The funding will enable the museum to create an engaging outdoor space, update signage with language for our diverse community, and improve accessibility throughout the grounds.
  • Your story belongs: The museum invites the public to a Community Visioning Workshop to brainstorm and imagine creative uses of the funding on Jun 28 at 5:30p. All ages are welcome to participate!

Register for the Community Visioning Workshop HERE.

posts.title: Celebrate The Fourth At Eureka Springs's Jamboreeka
posts.content:
Celebrate Independence Day at Eureka Springs's Jamboreeka! A family-friendly party featuring live bands, food & beer trucks, and a spectacular fireworks display at Lake Leatherwood Baseball Fields on Jul 2, from 5:30-9:30p.

  • Free ride: Admission is free, though donations to Eureka Springs Parks & Rec are appreciated to offset the cost of the event. A free trolley service will run from Planar Hill Parking Lot, the Transit Visitor Center, and the Transit Downtown Depot.
  • Party time: Enjoy music from Sprungbilly and Los Roscoes, tasty treats from Disco's Grill & Pineapple Paradise, and brews from Gotahold Brewing & Eureka Springs Brewery. Plus, there will be a dunk tank and waterslide, a nature hike, and an E-bike raffle.

Find more event details HERE.

posts.title: Grow Your Startup In The Greenhouse Outdoor Recreation Program
posts.content:
The Greenhouse Outdoor Recreation Program gives Northwest Arkansas's entrepreneurs in the outdoor recreation industry multiple levels of support to develop their ideas into products and services.

  • Ongoing Support: GORP Entrepreneurs gain access to workshops, networking events, 1:1 consulting, and use of the co-working space at the Greenhouse in Bentonville. 
  • Super Growth: Offered twice a year, the GORP Cohort is a competitive 12-week program, including workshops, a mentor team, product/service development support, and opportunities to earn up to $15K in non-dilutive funding. The next round's application deadline is Jul 10.

Get your outdoor recreation business growing HERE.

posts.title: Mount Olive Farms Opens Flower Field For Summer Season
posts.content:
Pick fresh flowers and build beautiful bouquets at Mount Olive Farms' Upick flower field, opening for the season this Saturday, Jun 24, from 8-11a.

  • Flower power: Mount Olive Farms is a regenerative farm in Northwest Arkansas specializing in cut and edible flower production. Each summer and fall, a portion of the farm is open for flower picking on Thursdays from 5:30-8:00p and Saturdays from 8-11a.
  • Bucket o' blossoms: Buckets and shears are provided, and for just $20, you can pick as many flowers as you can fit in the bucket. Bring a jar or bucket to transfer the flowers into, or flowers can be paper wrapped for transport home.

Follow Mount Olive Farms on Facebook and Instagram for updates, and learn more about what they do HERE.

posts.title: Watch The NBA Draft With The Razorbacks At JJ's LIVE
posts.content:
Join the Arkansas Men's Basketball Team for an NBA Draft Watch Party at JJ's Live this Thursday, Jun 22.

  • The Pig Leagues: Four Razorbacks are predicted as top picks in the 2023 NBA Draft, including Anthony Black, Nick Smith Jr., Ricky Council IV, and Jordan Walsh.
  • Join the party: Individual tickets start at $40, including a food buffet and chances to win team memorabilia in a raffle. You may even get a chance to meet some of the team's newest recruits!

Get your tickets while they last HERE.

posts.title: Opportunities Abound For Northwest Arkansas's Artists & Creatives
posts.content:
Finding NWA recently highlighted several funding opportunities for artists looking to impact their communities and participate in Northwest Arkansas's thriving arts scene.

  • Round and round: Artists 360 will take applications until Jun 28 for six $1,500 student grants, fourteen $7,500 project grants, and five $15,000 Community Activator grants. The Creative Exchange Fund is open through Jul 17 for 36 grants ranging from $1,500 - $15,000 in artist subsidies.
  • NWA Neighborhood Match Program.: Crowdfunding platform IOBY will double donations up to $1,000 per donor, up to $15,000 total, for local projects that repurpose public spaces for good. For example, Rogers is taking artist proposals for a public art project at Centennial Plaza.

Read more from Finding NWA HERE.

posts.title: Dive-In Movies Make A Splash At Wilson Park Pool
posts.content:
Put on your swimsuit and inflate the floaties! Dive-In Movies at Wilson Park Pool kicks off this week with the Super Mario Bros. Movie on Friday, Jun 23, at 7:15p.

  • Summer nights: Fayetteville Parks & Rec will host one more Dive-In Movie at Wilson Park Pool this summer, showing Aladdin on Jul 21.
  • Good times: Make a fun summer memory at Wilson Park Pool. Tickets are just $2 at the door or $1 if you buy in advance. Kids 5 and younger get it for free.

Get your advance tickets HERE.

posts.title: City Sessions Announces Summer Series
posts.content:
City Sessions kicks off its 10th season of unexpected, exceptional music experiences with three exciting shows this summer!

  • Country Roots: Hear Adam Hambrick + Common Roots at the Brittain's Home on Jun 30 at 6:30p.
  • Intriguing Indie: Tiny Camper + Will Gunselman perform live at Bike Rack Brewing on Jul 7 at 6:30p.
  • Rockin' Free: Alabama rock group Carver Commodore will play two free shows at Turnbow Park and Bike Rack Brewing on Jul 27-28.

Keep up with City Sessions news HERE.

posts.title: Mount Sequoyah Hosts Second Annual Fayetteville Movement Festival
posts.content:
Mount Sequoyah will host the 2nd annual Fayetteville Movement Festival, featuring a weekend of dance, yoga, functional movement, deep relaxation, live music, and more with movement professionals and local artists, from Jun 30 - Jul 2.

  • Creative movement: Open to people of all ages and backgrounds, the Fayetteville Movement Festival will be a weekend of connecting with the self and the community, building resilience and creativity through movement. Don't miss the Open Mic Night on Friday, hosted by Bxmbi, as poets, musicians, and theatrical performers showcase their talents.
  • Let's get moving: Whether you have previous experience with the art of movement or just getting started and want to feel more in sync with your body, the variety of classes offered this weekend offers something for everyone.

Find tickets and a full schedule of the weekend HERE.

posts.title: Razorback Athletics Hosts NWA Realtor Appreciation Event
posts.content:
Razorback Athletics invites all Northwest Arkansas Realtors to attend a special NWA REALTOR¬Æ Appreciation Event!

  • Gone Clubbin': The free event will take place on Tuesday, Jun 27, from 5-6:30p in the SEC Club of Donald W. Reynolds Razorback Stadium. Parking is available in Lot 44.
  • Mix and Mingle: Hear from Razorback Administration, mingle with other Realtors, enjoy complimentary appetizers and beverages, and even tour the facility. Attendees will also be entered to win door prizes.

RSVP for the NWA REALTOR¬Æ Appreciation Event HERE.

posts.title: Arkansas 211 Receives $100K From Walmart Foundation
posts.content:
The Walmart Foundation has granted Arkansas 211 $100,000 to expand its Ride United: Last Mile Delivery program ‚Äî which distributes healthy food to households in Washington and Benton counties without access.

  • Ride United: The program is a collaborative effort between Arkansas 211, United Way, and DoorDash providing food boxes and other essential supplies through no-cost home deliveries.
  • The final mile: Funding from the Walmart Foundation will expand the program beyond its pilot stage, enabling it to make over 12,000 home deliveries through 2024.

See how you can play a part in the work of Arkansas 211 HERE.

posts.title: Mount Up For The Rodeo Of The Ozarks In Springdale This Week
posts.content:
Saddle up for four nights of rodeo action during the 78th annual Rodeo of the Ozarks at Parsons Stadium in Springdale from Jun 21-24, beginning with the Rodeo Parade down Emma St. on Wednesday, Jun 21, at 10a.

  • Nightly action: Gates open at 5:30p daily with nightly themes like Faith & Family Night, Hispanic Heritage Night, "Rope Your Dreams" Night, and Let Freedom Ring Night.
  • Family fun: Witness heart-stopping rodeo competitions, hear talented musicians, laugh at hilarious clowns, and shop western lifestyle vendors while eating finger-licking-good rodeo food. Sign your kids up for the Mutton Bustin Championship for some real fun!

Check out more about the event and find tickets HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
It's a fun weekend in Northwest Arkansas with plenty of fun options to help you celebrate this Father's Day and Juneteenth weekend!

  • üë©‚Äçüé§ Off the rails: Railyard Live kicks off the weekend with The Red Lens, Protohive, and Kin & Co this Friday, Jun 16, then throws it back with a Madonna & Lady Gaga tribute on Saturday, Jun 17.
  • üé∑ Jazzy fresh: The Weekend Starts series continues at the Lower Ramble along the Razorback Greenway in Fayetteville with a jazz performance by the Coloring Twelve this Friday, Jun 16, at 5p.
  • üö¶Remembered: The City of Fayetteville will unveil a new historical marker and street renaming in honor of Nelson Hackett with a ceremony and live music celebration at the Pryor Center and Downtown Square this Friday, Jun 16, from 4-7:30p.
  • üòµ‚Äçüí´ In your head: Brick & Mortar in Rogers will host comedian-magician-hypnotist Zachary Gibson for a mindblowing show this Friday, Jun 16, from 7:15-8:30p.
  • üéπ It's Goin' Down: The 2023 Juneteenth Freedom Festival is this weekend, including performances by Bone Thugs-N-Harmony, Yung Joc, Funk Factory, and more, at Shiloh Square in Downtown Springdale on Saturday, June 17, from 1-9p.
  • üõù What a splash: Bentonville will celebrate the Grand Opening of Creekside Park with a ribbon-cutting event on Saturday, Jun 17, at 10a.
  • ü™ï I and Love and You: The heartfelt folk sound of The Avett Brothers will fill the Walmart AMP as they take the stage with opener Gov't Mule this Saturday, Jun 17 ‚Äî gates open at 6p, and the tunes kick off at 7:30p.
  • ‚ù§Ô∏è Party's pumpin': Paint the Town Red with the American Heart Association at JJ's Live for a Country themed event featuring a live DJ, food prepared by 15 local restaurants, and more this Saturday, Jun 17, at 7p.
  • üö¥ Get stoked: Buddy Pegs and bicycle innovators Gnargo Bikes are hosting a Kidical Mass Ride from Bentonville to Rogers and back this Saturday, Jun 17, from 9a-12p.
  • üî® Smashing good time: The newly opened Breakroom NWA in Rogers is running a BOGO 50% off deal for dads with coupon code DAD50 this Sunday, Jun 18, from 2-6p.
  • ‚öæ Defenders of the Diamond: The Naturals host a homes series this weekend, complete with a Fireworks Friday, Marvel Theme Night, and Father's Day T-Shirt giveaway, Jun 16-18.
  • ü™ì Chip chop: Dads throw free all weekend at Ozark Axe House in Rogers, along with several fun giveaways! Book your reservation with Promo Code DADDAY.

Have a great weekend, NWA!

posts.title: Baumann & Crosno Celebrates 10 Years Of Homebuilding In NWA
posts.content:
Talk Business & Politics recently featured Baumann & Crosno Construction, a local homebuilding group celebrating ten years in business and approaching its 1,000th closing.

  • Dedication: Started in 2013 by Mike Baumann and Michael Crosno, the company's meticulous commitment to quality has helped it grow to $230m in revenue, which the founders credit to their dedicated team of long-term employees, trade partners, and vendors.
  • Behind every man: Both partners also attributed much of their business's success to Michael's wife, Lane, who designs layouts for the group's spec homes, making each of them unique. She also consults clients doing custom builds under her company Lane Crosno Designs.

Read more on the story from Arkansas Money & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Enjoy Fireworks, Marvel Night, And Father's Day With The Naturals
posts.content:
The Northwest Arkansas Naturals' six-game series against the Frisco RoughRiders will be capped off with a weekend of celebrations starting with a Fireworks Friday on Jun 16.

  • Captain All-American: Saturday's theme is Marvel's Defenders of the Diamond. The team will be decked out in Marvel-designed jerseys and caps, available for purchase in an online auction. Rumor has it Ant-Man will make an appearance.
  • Catch with Dad: Father's Day on Sunday will feature free t-shirts for the first 500 Dads, $1 Hot Dogs from Tyson Foods Inc., and a chance to play a post-game round of catch on the field. Don't forget your gloves!

Purchase tickets HERE.

posts.title: NWA Daily Guide To Airbnbs in Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
Relatives or inlaws coming into town soon and need a subtle way to say, "Please don't stay at our place"? Just send them our guide showcasing 10 Unique Airbnbs in Northwest Arkansas. You may even find a neat staycation idea for yourself.

  • One of a kind: These unique short-term rentals are far from cookie-cutter. Find classy A-frames, luxury tree houses, and even houses listed on the Arkansas Historic Registry.
  • Experience NWA: Rent out your own speakeasy, enjoy an onsite bike washing station, or take a soak in a wood-fired cedar hot tub. Each rental offers something special. So, whether you‚Äôre biking, exploring Fayetteville‚Äôs Lower Ramble, or admiring the art at Crystal Bridges, you‚Äôll find your perfect home away from home in Northwest Arkansas.

Check out our top ten list of unique Airbnbs in NWA HERE.
